value.value: A plant regulatory promoter motif, composed of a highly conserved hexamer GATAAG (I-box core).
A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is introduced, moved or lost.

definition.value: Requested by Andy Menzies at the Sanger. This isn't necessarily a protein coding change. A premature start codon can effect the production of a mature protein product by providing a competing translation start point. Some genes balance their expression this way, eg THPO requires the presence of a premature start to limit expression, its loss leads to Familial thrombocythemia.

value.value: A gene cassette array that corresponds to a silenced version of a mating type region.
Any of the DNA segments produced by discontinuous synthesis of the lagging strand during DNA replication.

definition.value: Requested by Midori Harris, 2013.

value.value: A feature variant, where the alteration occurs upstream of the transcript TSS.

definition.value: Requested by Graham Ritchie, EBI/Sanger.
A feature variant, where the alteration occurs downstream of the transcript termination site.
Requested by Graham Ritchie, EBI/Sanger.

value.value: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is gained.
A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is lost.
A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is moved.
A consensus AFLP fragment is an AFLP sequence produced from any alignment algorithm which uses assembled multiple AFLP sequences as input.

definition.value: Requested by Bayer Cropscience September, 2013.

value.value: A non-synonymous variant is an inframe, protein altering variant, resulting in a codon change.
Intronic positions associated with cis-splicing. Contains the first and second positions immediately before the exon and the first, second and fifth positions immediately after.

definition.value: Added by Andy Menzies (Sanger).

value.value: Fifth intronic position after the intron exon boundary, close to the 5' edge of the intron.
A sequence variant occurring in the intron, within 10 bases of exon.

definition.value: Added by Andy Menzies (Sanger).

value.value: Region of intronic sequence within 10 bases of an exon.
A heterochromatic region of the chromosome, adjacent to the telomere (on the centromeric side) that contains repetitive DNA and sometimes genes and it is transcribed.
A small RNA oligo, typically about 20 bases, that guides the cas nuclease to a target DNA sequence in the CRISPR/cas mutagenesis method.
DNA motif that is a component of a mating type region.
A segment of non-homology between a and alpha mating alleles, found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR), has two forms (Ya and Yalpha).

definition.value: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

value.value: A mating type region motif, one of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

definition.value: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

value.value: A mating type region motif, the rightmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci (not present in HMR).

definition.value: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

value.value: The ACS is an 11-bp sequence of the form 5'-WTTTAYRTTTW-3' which is at the core of every yeast ARS, and is necessary but not sufficient for recognition and binding by the origin recognition complex (ORC). Functional ARSs require an ACS, as well as other cis elements in the 5' (C domain) and 3' (B domain) flanking sequences of the ACS.
The determinant of selective removal (DSR) motif consists of repeats of U(U/C)AAAC. The motif targets meiotic transcripts for removal during mitosis via the exosome.

definition.value: Requested by Antonia Locke, (Pombe).

value.value: A promoter element that has the consensus sequence GNMGATC, and is found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of zinc.

definition.value: This element is bound by Loz1 in S. pombe. The paper does not name the element. This term was requested by Midoris Harris, for Pombe.

value.value: An MNV is a multiple nucleotide variant (substitution) in which the inserted sequence is the same length as the replaced sequence.
A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding a rare amino acid is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

definition.value: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

value.value: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding selenocysteine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

definition.value: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

value.value: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding pyrrolysine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

definition.value: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

value.value: A variant that occurs within a gene but falls outside of all transcript features. This occurs when alternate transcripts of a gene do not share overlapping sequence.

definition.value: Requested by Pablo Cingolani, for use in SnpEff.

value.value: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon.

definition.value: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. This term should not be applied to incomplete transcripts.

value.value: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 5'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.
A sequence variant that causes the extension of 5' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.
A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 3' UTR with regard to the reference sequence.
A sequence variant that causes the extension of 3' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.
A sequence variant located in a conserved intergenic region, between genes.

definition.value: Requested by Uma Paila (UVA) for snpEff.

value.value: A transcript variant occurring within a conserved region of an intron.

definition.value: Requested by Uma Paila (UVA) for snpEff.

value.value: A sequence variant where at least one base in the start codon is changed, but the start remains.

definition.value: Requested by Uma Paila as this term is annotated by snpEff. This would be used for non_AUG start codon annotation.

value.value: Boundary elements are DNA motifs that prevent heterochromatin from spreading into neighboring euchromatic regions.

definition.value: Requested by Antonia Lock. Insulator is included as a related synonym since this is used to refer to insulator in the literature (NCBI:cf).

value.value: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.

definition.value: Requested by Midori Harris.

value.value: A small RNA molecule, 22-23 nt in size, that is the product of a longer RNA. The production of priRNAs is independent of dicer and involves binding of RNA by argonaute and trimming by triman. In fission yeast, priRNAs trigger the establishment of heterochromatin. PriRNAs are primarily generated from centromeric transcripts (dg and dh repeats), but may also be produced from degradation products of primary transcripts.

A nucleic tag which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library.
The leftmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci, but not present in HMR.

definition.value:
MERGED COMMENT:
TARGET COMMENT: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.
--------------------
SOURCE COMMENT: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

value.value: A genome region where chromosome pairing occurs preferentially during homologous chromosome pairing during early meiotic prophase of Meiosis I.

definition.value: Comment: An example of this is the Sme2 locus in fission yeast S. pombe, where is coincident with an ribonuclear complex termed the "Mei2 dot". This term was Requested by Val Wood, PomBase.

value.value: The nucleotide sequence which encodes the intein portion of the precursor gene.

definition.value: Requested by Janos Demeter 2014.

value.value: A short open reading frame that is found in the 5' untranslated region of an mRNA and plays a role in translational regulation.
An open reading frame that encodes a peptide of less than 100 amino acids.
A translated ORF encoded entirely within the antisense strand of a known protein coding gene.
One of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT and HMR).
A short hairpin RNA (shRNA) is an RNA transcript that makes a tight hairpin turn that can be used to silence target gene expression via RNA interference.
A non-coding transcript encoded by sequences adjacent to the ends of the 5' and 3' miR-encoding sequences that abut the loop in precursor miRNA.

definition.value:
MoRs are generated from miR hairpins that are longer and can produce two functional miR per strand. They are called moRs because they are not located next to the loop and thus their biogenesis process is a little different, but functionally, they are supposed to act like miRs. It is the same for loRs that are the loop fragments, they are generated differently than miRs or moRs but if loaded into the risc they are supposed to act the same way miRs do.
Requested by Thomas Desvignes, Jan 2015.
